response.raw_message_text:
{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("Age (18 years old)", "low", "Young age is a risk factor, but being at the threshold of adulthood can also indicate potential for change."),
    ("Gender (male)", "medium", "Males are statistically more likely to reoffend compared to females."),
    ("Ethnicity (Hispanic)", "low", "While ethnicity can be a contextual factor, it is not a strong predictor on its own without considering socioeconomic and environmental factors."),
    ("Arrest history (1 arrest, no convictions)", "medium", "A single arrest with no conviction suggests some involvement in the justice system but lacks the severity of multiple arrests or convictions."),
    ("Marital status (never married, not living alone)", "low", "Not being married is neutral, and living with others can provide social support."),
    ("Education (high school diploma, not enrolled in college)", "medium", "Having a high school diploma is positive, but lack of further education may limit opportunities."),
    ("Employment (1 job during the year)", "low", "Stable employment, even if only one job, suggests some level of responsibility and structure."),
    ("Drug use (no drug use in past four years)", "low", "Lack of recent drug use is a positive indicator for reduced risk."),
    ("Mental health (occasional feelings of depression)", "medium", "Feelings of depression can affect decision-making and coping mechanisms, but occasional symptoms are less concerning than chronic issues."),
    ("Family history (lived with both biological parents in a household of size 3)", "low", "Stable family environment during early years is generally positive."),
    ("Urban area", "medium", "Living in an urban area can expose individuals to more risk factors, but it also provides access to resources and support systems."),
    ("Religious beliefs (God has nothing to do with personal outcomes)", "medium", "Lack of religious belief or support may reduce a source of coping and social integration.")
  ],
  "prediction": "NO",
  "confidence": 65
}

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is an 18-year-old male who identifies himself as Hispanic. He has been arrested 1 time but has not been convicted. He is 5 feet 11 inches and weighs between 150 and 174 lbs. He has never been married and is currently not living alone. He has a high school diploma and is not enrolled in college. He has held 1 job during the year. He has not used any drugs in the past four years and some of the time during the past month he has felt so down in the dumps that nothing could cheer him up. At a young age, he lived with both of his biological parents in a household of size 3, in an urban area. He considers that God has nothing to do with what happens to him personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
